title: Robert518
author: Robert518
content: Any advice from those who have been in crypto for a long time for those who are seeing this market for the first time?

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: Read about bitcoin halving and how it may influence the price if cryptocurrencies.Know that trading is very risky, it is not gambling but consider it as gambling for starter because it can take money like gambling, I mean losses.Do not use the money you can not afford to lose to tradeLong term investment is profitable, especially in bear market like this.Be careful of people that provide signals, bots and copy trading. People will only require money from you but they do not care if you gain or lose and you may even lose after paying them.Learn trading from scratchKnow that newbie traders will surely lose, use the money lesser than the amount you can afford to lose to start trading.

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: Robert518 on July 04, 2022, 07:58:20 AMAny advice from those who have been in crypto for a long time for those who are seeing this market for the first time?Learn about Bitcoin price cycles.Learn about DCA.Learn to have patience.If you try do day trading, learn with small amounts, which you do afford to lose. If you try to invest, DCA. If you are unsure what to do, learn util you're sure (just make sure you finish your learning well before next ATH).I think that you're pretty much fortunate. Crypto winter is imho one of the best times to get into Bitcoin. Whether you invest or not yet, the experience remains.

comments.author: Baofeng
comments.body: Quote from: Robert518 on July 04, 2022, 07:58:20 AMAny advice from those who have been in crypto for a long time for those who are seeing this market for the first time?Market works in cycle: bulls and bears. In bull run the price is going up, majority of the coins are going to reach their all time high. But how can we earn more profit in bull run? Then the answer is that when the price is really down in the bear market, that is the time to buy because they are very cheap and just have the mental toughness to hold and wait for the next bull cycle.So if you are seeing this market for the first time, don't be discouraged, on the contrary, take this opportunity to accumulate.

comments.author: Maus0728
comments.body: That beat market is mostly a result of the collapse of overleveraged cryptocurrency-related companies, which causes investors to suffer significant financial losses. Consider the recent issues involving Voyager, Blockfi, Celcius, and 3AC, which stopped their deposit and withdrawal activities, causing billions of user funds to be locked up as a result of the market crash. Point is, having a non-custodial wallet that lets you grant full authority over your funds is a must rather than using vulnerable lending/exchange platforms as your main wallet to avoid such unprecedented financial repercussions.

comments.author: Wexnident
comments.body: If you're panicking about what's happening right now, look at the market charts but zoom out. Observe and see how the pattern of dumps and pumps has always happened and that it's something natural. See how price dumps have always recovered and probably more. Now, look at how long it took for those scenarios and start honing and understanding how much your patience is in play here. After that, I'd honestly just let you think for it yourself. If you want to keep hodling but are doubting, just repeat the cycle of checking the charts and reminding yourself that you're hodling for the long term.

comments.author: danherbias07
comments.body: Patience will help a lot in this situation. It may have been repeatedly said but it is the only way.You cannot force it when there's really nothing that can be done. Just like what happened when the last bear came. It went below $3k if my memory serves me correctly, you'll get mad just thinking about how far it went down but at the end of the day, you cannot do anything about it. Perhaps if you have some spare money or you sold at the peak, you can use that to just pile up more cryptocurrencies that are trusted and just wait for another pump to come.

comments.author: wheelz1200
comments.body: Quote from: Robert518 on July 04, 2022, 07:58:20 AMAny advice from those who have been in crypto for a long time for those who are seeing this market for the first time?The worst is yet to come!  Seriously people are looking at bitcoin like it's flattened out its a mirage.  Altcoin volume will dry up and dip and bitcoin I could see slowly retracing back a bit more.  With economic uncertainty in the air it's only gonna exasperated the issue.  My best advise would be to not go all in right now.  Cost average into bitcoin so you can lower your cost if it slides yet have a stake in the game if it does actually spike up.  Be prepared for.tough times ahead though.

comments.author: livingfree
comments.body: Quote from: Robert518 on July 04, 2022, 07:58:20 AMAny advice from those who have been in crypto for a long time for those who are seeing this market for the first time?Take time to analyze that this has to happen but the market won't be on this situation forever.I know how bad it feels when your investment has lost that much. But you're not the only ones that are in loss here, as someone who has experienced bears. I've learned that those people that have understood the cycles are the ones who wins on this market. As said about halving, it will make the market go bullish again. It's not just a coincidence but this is the time for you to be more patient.

comments.author: Jody.Drummer
comments.body: Quote from: Robert518 on July 04, 2022, 07:58:20 AMAny advice from those who have been in crypto for a long time for those who are seeing this market for the first time?Even though they have been in the crypto world for a long time, it does not mean that the person fully understands the ins and outs of crypto. This is only based on individual experience. Because crypto knowledge doesn't have a major like you in lectures that can easily get fixed material or theory. Sometimes even though it takes a long time, it is clear that understanding can be obtained from the type of person who is diligent, deep in the investment world, or just trading. The composition will be different according to the purpose sought.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Enter the market as a long-term investor.Always leave some cash in hand to buy when the price drops.Leave enough money to have for six months or a year.Withdraw your capital early and let the profits grow for more than 5 years.Learn how to control your emotions and how to avoid emotional investment.Bitcoin is not a model to get rich quickly but rather how to get out of poverty.

comments.author: BitcoinPanther
comments.body: Quote from: Robert518 on July 04, 2022, 07:58:20 AMAny advice from those who have been in crypto for a long time for those who are seeing this market for the first time?If you are holding Bitcoin then just have patience price will surely recover even if it will take months to years but for sure it won't pass the halving on 2024.  If you have extra money try to DCA for maximum profit.  This had been an effective investing strategy  for many of us.

comments.author: abel1337
comments.body: Don't panic when we experience massive downfall prices, Take it as an opportunity to buy or to make profit from the market. This is were I failed to do last bear market, Getting myself down because of the bear market makes me lose the big opportunity that other people take. If you came from the recent bull market, It would be nice if you stored some stable coin or fiat to fuel your future crypto purchases. Buying on the dip would be a very good move especially if those reaches a massive support, Being ready of having a fund would make it easy for you to make a purchase. Just be knowledgeable about crypto, have a funds to fuel up your crypto purchase, take advantage of the worst scenarios. and accumulate as much as you can.

comments.author: Silberman
comments.body: Quote from: Robert518 on July 04, 2022, 07:58:20 AMAny advice from those who have been in crypto for a long time for those who are seeing this market for the first time?My advice would be to have a lot of patience, people had a lot of time to learn more about the bear markets before facing one but most likely many of those same people refused to do so as they were too happy to obtain profits during the bull market, and now they have to learn about this market while also experiencing it at the same time, which is by far the most difficult way to learn, so they need patience more than anything, the bear market at some point will end and only those which can keep holding their coins will be able to enjoy the full bull run that comes next, so while it is difficult to endure such a massive drop in the price it is something we must do.

comments.author: crzy
comments.body: Quote from: Robert518 on July 04, 2022, 07:58:20 AMAny advice from those who have been in crypto for a long time for those who are seeing this market for the first time?Just continue to learn, and trade based on your own analysis. The market is very volatile and if the newbie didn’t do his own research, there’s a high possibility for them to lose the money. Trading is not easy for every newbie, just take it easy and learn every steps so you can be good, be more patience as well. You can be more successful once you already know what to do during bear market.

comments.author: Sanitough
comments.body: Quote from: Robert518 on July 04, 2022, 07:58:20 AMAny advice from those who have been in crypto for a long time for those who are seeing this market for the first time? Always know that the crypto market do not stay up always, it will also stay low and create price decline. But the good thing about is, whatever the condition of the market, it has always its own opportunities to earn and become profitable so always act rightly.In times when the market is very bearish and you witness all the coins are in low prices, don't over react. That's part of the bearish market. The only challenge you have to overcome is to survive in this market condition and it will only be possible if you chose to stay calm and patient, and just keep on buying even when the market gets deeper.

comments.author: Japinat
comments.body: Quote from: molsewid on July 04, 2022, 03:13:37 PMQuote from: Robert518 on July 04, 2022, 07:58:20 AMAny advice from those who have been in crypto for a long time for those who are seeing this market for the first time?My advice is simple, don't expect too much in crypto. I can give you sunshine but crypto can give you thunderstorms as well. Before entering any market, you should learn to make a research first about the coin, about their roadmap, plans, strategies, use case and also better if you will learn different jargon related to trading, also prepare your emotional and mental health, trading can give you breakdown in your first few years.  I guess that explains all. Also, do not invest in crypto for quick profits because it takes first a lot of hardwork and wise moves in the market before you can be profitable. And only invest on the amount you can afford to lose, as the crypto market is not all about profiting, but you also have to endure a lot of losses before you can learn your own strategies, and having good strategies do not still guarantees that you'll be profitable already. The fact is, you have to learn in crypto the hard way.

comments.author: samcrypto
comments.body: Quote from: Robert518 on July 04, 2022, 07:58:20 AMAny advice from those who have been in crypto for a long time for those who are seeing this market for the first time?Invest on your knowledge first and don’t rush in the market.I know its bear and you might feel the FOMO but better not to rush and keep analyzing first. This bear market might take more time before it recovers so you still have time to study. Newbies should buy established coin first or the top projects so you can still have the assurance that it will rise again. I was once a newbie and made some mistakes before, I believe you have to learn from those mistakes in order for you to become more successful. Don’t feel any FOMO, just stay on your course and know when to buy and sell.

comments.author: Quidat
comments.body: Quote from: Robert518 on July 04, 2022, 07:58:20 AMAny advice from those who have been in crypto for a long time for those who are seeing this market for the first time?- Know the main thing which do talks about "volatility"- Know about fud and fomo- Know anonymity and decentralization- Know and tend to look those past history or events about price pumps and crashes- Dont make yourself greedy and impulsive- Stick with your analysis  and dont rely on other calls and suggestion but its not bad to snip out some ideas.- Dont believe on so-called experts Gain experience and learning as you do go ahead or further yet you are the ones who would able to grasps on something you do encounter.

comments.author: GreatArkansas
comments.body: Quote from: Robert518 on July 04, 2022, 07:58:20 AMAny advice from those who have been in crypto for a long time for those who are seeing this market for the first time?Learn from your mistakes. Be consistent.Even though this is your first, I believe you will learn a lot or already learned. If you are still here for the long term, you will be able to use those learnings in the future and become ready for the next different situations.I remember before last 2017-2018 market when it was my first time too and yeah it really hurts, I lost too much. But when the market started to recover last year, I applied my learnings and become profitable.
